title: Classic Sausage Stuffing for Thanksgiving Family Gatherings

description: This Classic Sausage Stuffing is the ultimate Thanksgiving side dish that everyone will love. Buttery and savory, with a perfect crispy edge, it's a must-have for your holiday table. Try this foolproof recipe to impress your family!
instructions: In a large skillet, cook the sausage over medium heat until browned, breaking it apart as it cooks.
Add butter, onion, and celery to the skillet, cooking until softened.
In a large bowl, combine bread cubes, sausage mixture, chicken broth, sage, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish and cover with foil.
Bake for 30 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for an additional 30 minutes until golden brown.
tips: For perfect results, use day-old bread for better texture and flavor absorption.

structured_content.content: This Classic Sausage Stuffing is a beloved dish that brings warmth and joy to any Thanksgiving table. With its buttery texture and savory flavors, it’s sure to be a hit with family and friends. The crispy edges add a delightful contrast to the soft interior, making each bite a comforting experience.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 2 hours
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for Thanksgiving and holiday gatherings

structured_content.content: Growing up, my family always made this stuffing for Thanksgiving. The aroma of sausage and herbs filled the house, creating a sense of warmth and togetherness. It's a tradition that I cherish and love to share with my own family now.

• Main ingredient: Use a flavorful sausage for the best taste; I prefer a mild Italian sausage.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Sage and thyme are essential for that classic stuffing flavor.
  • Supporting ingredients: Bread cubes should be slightly stale for optimal texture.
  • Equipment needed: A large skillet and a baking dish are essential for this recipe.

upload.context: Preparation of the ingredients for the sausage stuffing, showcasing the chopped vegetables and bread cubes.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Start by preheating your oven and preparing your ingredients. Cook the sausage until browned, then add the vegetables.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Combine all ingredients and transfer to a baking dish. Cover with foil and bake, then uncover to achieve a crispy top.
Finishing Touches:
Let it cool slightly before serving to allow flavors to meld.

upload.context: Cooking process of the sausage stuffing, highlighting the mixture in the skillet and the baking dish.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook the sausage thoroughly for the best flavor.
  • Avoid overcooking the stuffing to keep it moist.
  • Look for a golden brown color on top to indicate it's ready.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: This stuffing is more than just a side dish; it's a centerpiece of our family gatherings. Sharing it with loved ones makes every holiday memorable.
Consider adding chopped apples or cranberries for a touch of sweetness, or swap in different herbs like rosemary for a unique twist.
This stuffing pairs beautifully with turkey, gravy, and cranberry sauce. Serve it alongside roasted vegetables for a complete meal.
For a gluten-free option, use gluten-free bread. You can also make it vegetarian by omitting the sausage and adding mushrooms instead.

upload.context: Final plated dish of the sausage stuffing, beautifully garnished and ready to serve.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use fresh herbs for a vibrant flavor boost.
  • Let the stuffing sit for a few minutes before serving to enhance the texture.
  • Timing is key; keep an eye on it to prevent burning.
  • Garnish with fresh parsley for an appealing presentation.

structured_content.content: Embrace the joy of cooking this Classic Sausage Stuffing, and let it bring your family together for a memorable holiday feast!
